sentences.en: ...features that make their products distinguishable from those of their rivals.
sentences.cn: …将他们的产品与其竞争对手们的产品区别开来的一些特色。

sentences.en: A black object is not easily distinguishable on a dark night.
sentences.cn: 在漆黑的夜晚黑色物体不易辨识.

sentences.en: Conclusion 7 spots were clearly distinguishable on the TLC plate.
sentences.cn: 通过薄层色谱试验表明,茜草藤的正丁醇萃取液在硅胶板上可分离出清晰的7个斑点.

sentences.en: Distinct patterns correspond to distinguishable bracelets.
sentences.cn: 不同的形对应不同的手镯.

sentences.en: He put his ear to the floor and heard angry shouts, but no words were distinguishable.
sentences.cn: 他把耳朵贴在地板上，听到了怒吼，但是听不清所说的内容。

sentences.en: It was getting light and shapes were more distinguishable.
sentences.cn: 天亮起来了，万物变得更清晰了。

sentences.en: The animal is easily distinguishable by the black stripes above its eye.
sentences.cn: 这类动物很容易通过其眼睛上方的黑色条纹识别出来.

sentences.en: The male bird is barely distinguishable from the female.
sentences.cn: 雄鸟和雌鸟几乎无法辨别.

sentences.en: The newcomers were scarcely distinguishable from their predecessors.
sentences.cn: 无论新人或朋友,几乎全被一视同仁.

sentences.en: The process of government involves three distinguishable functions.
sentences.cn: 统治的管理过程包括三项不同的职能.

sentences.en: They found the surface layer of the cell discontinuous and distinguishable from the cytoplasm.
sentences.cn: 他们发现细胞的表层跟细胞质是一不连续的和有差别的.

sentences.en: This is vintage port, and it is distinguishable by its deep red colour.
sentences.cn: 这是佳酿葡萄酒，它有特别的深红色。

sentences.en: Those two models are not easily distinguishable from each other.
sentences.cn: 那两种型号不易区别开来.

sentences.en: Tom is hardly distinguishable from his twin brother.
sentences.cn: 汤姆和他的孪生哥哥几乎令人分辨不出.

sentences.en: Vipers are distinguishable from other snakes by their markings.
sentences.cn: 根据蛇身上的斑纹就能把┹蛇同其他蛇类区别开来.

sentences.en: Winston turned a switch and the voice sank somewhat, though the words were still distinguishable.
sentences.cn: 温斯顿拧了个旋钮,声音便小了一点, 可讲的话依然听得清.

words.tran_cn: 明显的；独特的；清楚的；有区别的
区别；差别；特性；荣誉、勋章
区分；辨别；使杰出，使表现突出

trans.tran_cn: 可以区别开的，可辨别的
trans.tran_en: easy to recognize as being different from something else
